p: The PEDOT/GC electrode was investigated in an aqueous solution of 0.1 M NaClO 4 in the potential range from −0.65 V to 1.25 V vs Ag + at a scan rate of 0.05 V/ s. Cu was electrochemically deposited on PEDOT/GC electrode using a 2 mM solution of CuSO 4 in 0.1 M NaClO 4 at a constant potential of +0.34 V vs. SHE for 120 s. Then the electrodeposited Cu on PEDOT electrode was washed with milli-Q water. The Cu modified PEDOT/GC electrode was examined by cyclic voltammetry in the scan range from 0.0 V to 1.25 V at a scan rate of 0.05 V/ s vs. SHE.
